project.title: Newspaper Visual Question and Answering
project.description: Objective: To develop an end-to-end Retrieval-Augmented Generation application that efficiently searches a vector knowledge database of e-newspapers and fetches the best matching articles related to the prompted question. It uses YOLOv8 to segment the newspaper into individual entities, OCR to extract the content, a vector database to store the content, and a Sentence Transformer (all-MiniLM-L6-v2) to find the best match for the question within the knowledge database. It also includes a feedback mechanism that suggests previously asked similar questions and their related articles to users, enhancing user experience and accuracy of 41.96%.
project.toolsAndTechnology: React, Python, Hugging Face, SQLite 3, ChromaDB, Roboflow, Tesseract OCR

project.title: Attendance System
project.description: Objective: To develop an online attendance system that integrates face detection to verify a student’s presence via webcam when they submit their attendance photo, allowing lecturers to cross-check submissions with registered photos for authentication. It includes multiple attendance submissions for students at random intervals during the lecture. IT Department lecturers found this very innovative and helpful.
project.toolsAndTechnology: Javascript, HTML/CSS, Bootstrap, Go Lang, PostgreSQL, pg Agent, FaceDetection.js

project.title: Student Performance Prediction and Analysis
project.description: Objective: To analyze the Open University Learning Analytics dataset to understand student performance and dropout patterns using clustering algorithms and data mining techniques. Predicted student performance using various supervised machine learning models and the most efficient and accurate model was Artificial Neural Networks, which had a 90% accuracy score.
project.toolsAndTechnology: Python, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Seaborn

project.title: ARTutor
project.description: Objective: To develop an AR application that tracks human pose coordinates using a webcam, streams the data in real time, and uses a smartphone to receive the stream and augment a coordinate-mapped 3D human model onto a real-world plane surface. It utilizes multi-threading to broadcast the coordinates and receive the coordinates at different processing speeds, which is bridged by a buffer queue. AR Tutor was selected for representing IT Department for NAAC evaluation.
project.toolsAndTechnology: Python, Socket Programming, C#, Unity AR/VR, Media Pipe Pose Tracking Library, Threads

project.title: AR Learning App – From 3D to 2D Shapes
project.description: Objective: To develop an Augmented Reality (AR) application that helps second-grade students understand the relationship between 3D objects and their 2D projections. Inspired by the Tamil Nadu SCERT Grade 2 Mathematics textbook, the app spawns a virtual AR classroom where children can explore shapes like cubes, cuboids, cones, cylinders, and spheres, and see how 2D shapes emerge from them through impressions, shadows, and transformations.
project.toolsAndTechnology: Unity3D, C#, Unity AR Foundation, Plane Tracking, Vuforia

project.title: 2D Infinite Runner Game
project.description: Objective: To design and implement a tile-based endless runner game using Python's Pygame module. The player controls a cowboy character who must continuously run, jump, and slide to avoid obstacles such as bats and crates. The game keeps track of the distance covered, displays a score upon collision, and restarts for continuous gameplay. It was built as a fun project to explore game development with Python.
project.toolsAndTechnology: Python, Pygame, Computer Graphics, Event Handling

project.title: Code to DOCX
project.description: Objective: To create a Python-based automation tool that compiles source code files and their corresponding output screenshots into a structured Microsoft Word (.docx) document. This system is especially useful for students preparing coding assignments or documentation. It supports multiple programming languages, allows including or excluding code, and organizes content using folder-based workflows.
